title: College Assembly/ College Forum
requirements: Wu Yee Sun College Assembly / Forum
description: Students are required to attend at least one College Assembly each term. This is to allow teachers and students to gather, so as to reflect upon University life.Several College Forums will be organized every year and College students are required to attend at least one College Forum each term. The Forum aims at enhancing general knowledge through extensive interaction with distinguished speakers from different professions and academic disciplines.
outcome: Upon completing this course, students will be able to: 1.appreciate the essence of university life and university learning, and 2.appreciate the core values of the College in enhancing entrepreneurial spirit and social responsibility.

title: Creative Social Responsibility and Sustainable Development
requirements: For Year 1 Wu Yee Sun College students only.
description: This course consists of four major components:1. Our Roles for a Sustainable Future How can we lead a good life in a just society? How can individual actions affect events at a global scale? These are the questions every student should ask and take seriously. We will explore them through the United Nation’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) in this section of the course.2. Sustainable Development for Our FutureThis section of the course seeks to help students to think about what their future is going to be like if humanity continues business-as-usual. Selected issues that critically impact the future of our planet will be discussed. In-depth discussion on the issues, including responses from various sectors of the society around the world, will be guided by the SDG Framework.3. Sustainable Development of Cities and Communities to Ensure Good Health and Well-beingThis section of the course enhances students’ knowledge on impact of urban development on health and well-being by making use of concept of Healthy City to illustrate socio-economic and political determinants of health. It aims to broaden the students’ concept of health and well-being to address issues of sustainable urban development. This section focuses on 2 key SDG’s, Good Health and Well-being (SDG 3) and Sustainable Cities and Communities (SDG 11). Other determinants for health and well-being, such as reduction of poverty (SDG 1) and reduction of inequality (SDG 10), and health justice (SDG 16), will also be discussed. 4. Creativity and Design Thinking for a Sustainable FutureThis section of the course examines the topic of creativity and design thinking. The key question to be discussed is how we can put design creativity to good use in our everyday life as well as in projects that we choose to pursue to create a world of peace and prosperity.
outcome: Upon completing this course, the student will be able to:  describe the importance of sustainable development for their future;  analyse the impact of their actions on their future and value the needs for sustainable development explain the importance of sustainability in society, and how to lead a healthy and positive life; appreciate design thinking from an interdisciplinary perspective, with the potential of applying such knowledge to propose new ventures to improve sustainability of the world  在完成本科後, 學生將:  1. 了解可持續發展對自己將來的重要性 2. 分析個人行動對未來發展的影響，並理解可持續發展的需要 3. 明白社會可持續發展的重要，以及如何活出健康與正向的人生 4. 從跨學科學角度了解設計思維, 並將該知識應用至創意事業
syllabus: Section 1: The importance of sustainable development for our future Inequalities, social justice, and development Local action, global impact Section 2: Critical issue for a sustainable future Roles of key stakeholders for a sustainable future Actions required for a sustainable future Section 3: The positive and negative impact of urbanization on health and well-being and how to sustain cities and communities for better health and well-being Making use of concept of Healthy City to tackle the socio-economic and political determinants of health, e.g., reduction of poverty and inequality, addressing justice in health How public health intervention would best serve the interest of public? The importance and relevance of UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDG 2030) for our society Section 4: What is design thinking? What is creativity?  Applying design thinking to achieve a sustainable future

title: College Senior Seminar
description: A group of students work on an innovative and entrepreneurial idea (a product, a venture or a service) which shows promise in bringing practical social benefits to the community. The idea should be feasible, sustainable, and promising in terms of improving social well-being. Each group should consist of students from diverse backgrounds. Students may form their own groups. Students will work under the supervision of an instructor, who guides the students from the creation of an idea to the writing and presentation of a proposal and/or action plan. Performance throughout the work process is graded. Advisory: For Final Year College students only.
outcome: Upon completing this course, the student will be able to:  1. exercise own creativity in designing an innovative social venture  2. form an opinion on the viability and effectiveness of a social venture   3. work and communicate effectively in a team work environment   4. write proposals/action plans and present them in verbal and written forms   完成本科後, 學生將可:  1. 透過設計創新的社會計劃去發揮創意  2. 就社會計劃的可行性及有效性提出見解  3. 在團隊環境中有效地溝通合作  4. 撰寫計劃書/行動計劃, 並以口述和書面形式作報告
syllabus: This is a capstone course that requires students to create plans for new ventures with the promise of bringing social benefits to the community. Students will work in small teams – draw up plans and present them to the class. The scope of creativity is unlimited.
required_readings: To be prescribed by the instructor of the course according to the students’ interests.
recommended_readings: To be prescribed by the instructor of the course according to the students’ interests.
